trans-unit.source: Encapsulates operating system–specific objects that wait for exclusive access to shared resources.
The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class encapsulates Win32 synchronization handles, and is used to represent all synchronization objects in the runtime that allow multiple wait operations.
trans-unit.target: La <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase encapsula identificadores de sincronización de Win32 y se utiliza para representar todos los objetos de sincronización en el tiempo de ejecución que permiten varias operaciones de espera.

trans-unit.source: For a comparison of wait handles with other synchronization objects, see [Overview of Synchronization Primitives](~/docs/standard/threading/overview-of-synchronization-primitives.md).
trans-unit.target: Para obtener una comparación de identificadores de espera con otros objetos de sincronización, vea [información general sobre los primitivos de sincronización](~/docs/standard/threading/overview-of-synchronization-primitives.md).

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class itself is abstract.
trans-unit.target: La <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase es abstracta.

trans-unit.source: Classes derived from <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> define a signaling mechanism to indicate taking or releasing access to a shared resource, but they use the inherited <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> methods to block while waiting for access to shared resources.
trans-unit.target: Las clases derivadas de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> definir un mecanismo de señalización para indicar que están tomando o liberando acceso a un recurso compartido, pero usan el heredados <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> métodos para bloquear mientras se espera para el acceso a recursos comparten.

trans-unit.source: The classes derived from <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> include:
trans-unit.target: Las clases derivadas de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> incluyen:

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Mutex> class.
trans-unit.target: La clase <xref:System.Threading.Mutex>.

trans-unit.source: See [Mutexes](~/docs/standard/threading/mutexes.md).
trans-unit.target: Vea [exclusiones mutuas](~/docs/standard/threading/mutexes.md).

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> class and its derived classes, <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> and <xref:System.Threading.ManualResetEvent>.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> clase y sus clases derivadas, <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent> y <xref:System.Threading.ManualResetEvent>.

trans-unit.source: See [EventWaitHandle, AutoResetEvent, CountdownEvent, ManualResetEvent](~/docs/standard/threading/eventwaithandle-autoresetevent-countdownevent-manualresetevent.md).
trans-unit.target: Vea [EventWaitHandle, AutoResetEvent, CountdownEvent, ManualResetEvent](~/docs/standard/threading/eventwaithandle-autoresetevent-countdownevent-manualresetevent.md).

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.Semaphore> class.
trans-unit.target: La clase <xref:System.Threading.Semaphore>.

trans-unit.source: See [Semaphore and SemaphoreSlim](~/docs/standard/threading/semaphore-and-semaphoreslim.md).
trans-unit.target: Vea [Semaphore y SemaphoreSlim](~/docs/standard/threading/semaphore-and-semaphoreslim.md).

trans-unit.source: Threads can block on an individual wait handle by calling the instance method <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitOne%2A>, which is inherited by classes derived from <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.
trans-unit.target: Los subprocesos pueden bloquear en un identificador de espera individual llamando al método de instancia <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitOne%2A>, que es heredado por las clases derivadas de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.

trans-unit.source: The derived classes of <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> differ in their thread affinity.
trans-unit.target: Las clases derivadas de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> difieren en su afinidad de subprocesos.

trans-unit.source: Event wait handles (<xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle>, <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>, and <xref:System.Threading.ManualResetEvent>) and semaphores do not have thread affinity; any thread can signal an event wait handle or semaphore.
trans-unit.target: Identificadores de espera de evento (<xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle>, <xref:System.Threading.AutoResetEvent>, y <xref:System.Threading.ManualResetEvent>) y los semáforos no tienen afinidad de subprocesos; cualquier subproceso puede señalar un identificador de espera de evento o un semáforo.

trans-unit.source: Mutexes, on the other hand, do have thread affinity; the thread that owns a mutex must release it, and an exception is thrown if a thread calls the <xref:System.Threading.Mutex.ReleaseMutex%2A> method on a mutex that it does not own.
trans-unit.target: Las exclusiones mutuas, por otro lado, tienen afinidad de subprocesos; el subproceso que posee una exclusión mutua debe liberarlo y se produce una excepción si un subproceso llama a la <xref:System.Threading.Mutex.ReleaseMutex%2A> método en una exclusión mutua que no le pertenece.

trans-unit.source: Because the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class derives from <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject>, these classes can be used to synchronize the activities of threads across application domain boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Dado que la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase se deriva de <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject>, estas clases se pueden utilizar para sincronizar las actividades de subprocesos en los límites del dominio de aplicación.

trans-unit.source: In addition to its derived classes, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class has a number of static methods that block a thread until one or more synchronization objects receive a signal..
trans-unit.target: Además de sus clases derivadas, la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase tiene un número de métodos estáticos que bloquea un subproceso hasta que uno o más objetos de sincronización reciban una señal...

trans-unit.source: These include:
trans-unit.target: Se incluyen los siguientes:

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A>, which allows a thread to signal one wait handle and immediately wait on another.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A>, que permite que un subproceso indicar un identificador de espera y espere inmediatamente a otro.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A>, which allows a thread to wait until all the wait handles in an array receive a signal.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A>, que permite que un subproceso debe esperar hasta que todos los identificadores de espera de una matriz reciban una señal.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A>, which allows a thread to wait until any one of a specified set of wait handles has been signaled .
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A>, que permite que un subproceso debe esperar hasta que se haya señalado cualquiera de un conjunto de identificadores de espera especificado.

trans-unit.source: The overloads of these methods provide timeout intervals for abandoning the wait, and the opportunity to exit a synchronization context before entering the wait, allowing other threads to use the synchronization context.
trans-unit.target: Las sobrecargas de estos métodos proporcionan intervalos de tiempo de espera para abandonar la espera y la oportunidad de salir de un contexto de sincronización antes de entrar en la espera, que permite que otros subprocesos utilizar el contexto de sincronización.

trans-unit.source: This type implements the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo implementa la <xref:System.IDisposable> interfaz.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished using the type or a type derived from it, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly.
trans-unit.target: Cuando haya terminado de utilizar el tipo o un tipo derivado de éste, debe eliminar del mismo directa o indirectamente.

trans-unit.source: To dispose of the type directly, call its <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> method in a `try`/`catch` block.
trans-unit.target: Para deshacerse del tipo directamente, llame a su <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> método en un `try` / `catch` bloque.

trans-unit.source: To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic).
trans-unit.target: Para deshacerse de él indirectamente, use una construcción de lenguaje como `using` (en C#) o `Using` (en Visual Basic).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface topic.
trans-unit.target: Para obtener más información, vea la sección "Uso de un objeto que implementa IDisposable" en el <xref:System.IDisposable> tema de la interfaz.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> implements the <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> pattern.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> implementa el <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> patrón.

trans-unit.source: See [Dispose Pattern](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md).
trans-unit.target: Vea [patrón de Dispose](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md).

trans-unit.source: When you derive from <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>, use the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> property to store your native handle operating system handle.
trans-unit.target: Al derivar de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>, use el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> propiedad para almacenar el identificador del sistema operativo de identificador nativo.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to override the protected <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose%2A> method unless you use additional unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: No es necesario reemplazar el protegido <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose%2A> método a menos que utilice recursos no administrados adicionales.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how two threads can do background tasks while the Main thread waits for the tasks to complete using the static <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> and <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class.
trans-unit.target: El siguiente ejemplo de código muestra cómo dos subprocesos pueden realizan tareas en segundo plano mientras el método Main subproceso espera a que las tareas se completan mediante el método estático <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> y <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> métodos de la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase.

trans-unit.source: This type is thread safe.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo es seguro para la ejecución de subprocesos.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> class.
Releases all resources held by the current <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" />.
This method is the public implementation of the <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method for the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> class and its derived classes.
trans-unit.target: Este método es una implementación pública de la <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> método para el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> clase y sus clases derivadas.

trans-unit.source: It provides a standard implementation that calls the `Dispose(Boolean)` overload with a `true` argument and then calls the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
trans-unit.target: Proporciona una implementación estándar que llama el `Dispose(Boolean)` sobrecarga con un `true` argumento y, a continuación, llama el <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> método.

trans-unit.source: Call this method to release all resources held by an instance of `WaitHandle` or a derived class.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a este método para liberar todos los recursos mantenidos por una instancia de `WaitHandle` o una clase derivada.

trans-unit.source: Once this method is called, references to the current instance cause undefined behavior.
trans-unit.target: Una vez que se llama a este método, las referencias a la instancia actual provocar un comportamiento indefinido.

trans-unit.source: Always call <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> or <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.
trans-unit.target: Llame siempre a <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> o <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> antes de liberar la última referencia a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed.
trans-unit.target: En caso contrario, no se liberarán los recursos que está usando.

trans-unit.source: You should override the <see langword="Dispose(Boolean)" /> method to release resources allocated in derived classes.
trans-unit.target: Debe invalidar el <see langword="Dispose(Boolean)" /> método para liberar los recursos asignados en las clases derivadas.

trans-unit.source: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> class
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> class.
This method is equivalent to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Este método es equivalente a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: Always call <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> or <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.
trans-unit.target: Llame siempre a <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> o <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> antes de liberar la última referencia a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed.
trans-unit.target: En caso contrario, no se liberarán los recursos que está usando.

trans-unit.source: <see langword="true" /> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <see langword="false" /> to release only unmanaged resources.
When overridden in a derived class, releases the unmanaged resources used by the <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" />, and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> and the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> methods with the `explicitDisposing` parameter set to `true`.
trans-unit.target: Este método es invocado por el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close%2A> y <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose> métodos con el `explicitDisposing` parámetro establecido en `true`.

trans-unit.source: When the `explicitDisposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> object references.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el `explicitDisposing` parámetro es `true`, este método libera todos los recursos retenidos por los objetos administrados que este <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> referencias a objetos.

trans-unit.source: You should override the <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose(System.Boolean)" /> method to release resources allocated in derived classes.
trans-unit.target: Debe invalidar el <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose(System.Boolean)" /> método para liberar los recursos asignados en las clases derivadas.

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close" /> or <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose" /> method can be called multiple times by other objects.
trans-unit.target: El <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Close" /> o <see cref="M:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose" /> método puede recibir varias llamadas de otros objetos.

trans-unit.source: When overriding this method, be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier call to <see langword="Dispose" /> or <see langword="Close" />.
trans-unit.target: Al reemplazar este método, tenga cuidado de no hacer referencia a objetos que se hayan eliminado en una llamada anterior a <see langword="Dispose" /> o <see langword="Close" />.

trans-unit.source: Gets or sets the native operating system handle.
An <see langword="IntPtr" /> representing the native operating system handle.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="IntPtr" /> que representa el identificador del sistema operativo nativo.

trans-unit.source: The default is the value of the <see cref="F:System.Threading.WaitHandle.InvalidHandle" /> field.
trans-unit.target: El valor predeterminado es el valor del campo <see cref="F:System.Threading.WaitHandle.InvalidHandle" />.

trans-unit.source: Assigning a new value to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle%2A> property does not close the previous handle.
trans-unit.target: Asignar un nuevo valor para el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle%2A> propiedad no cierra el identificador anterior.

trans-unit.source: This can result in a leaked handle.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede dar lugar a un identificador con pérdidas.

trans-unit.source: Do not use this property in the .NET Framework version 2.0 or later; use the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> property instead.
trans-unit.target: No utilice esta propiedad en .NET Framework versión 2.0 o posterior; Utilice la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> propiedad en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: Setting this property to a valid handle also sets the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> property, but setting it to <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.InvalidHandle> can result in a leaked handle.
trans-unit.target: Establecer esta propiedad en un identificador válido también establece la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> propiedad, pero si se establece en <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.InvalidHandle> puede dar lugar a un identificador con pérdidas.

trans-unit.source: Requires full trust for the immediate caller to set the property value.
trans-unit.target: Requiere plena confianza para el llamador inmediato establecer el valor de propiedad.

trans-unit.source: This member cannot be set by partially trusted or transparent code.
trans-unit.target: Este miembro no se puede establecer mediante código de confianza parcial o transparente.

trans-unit.source: Derived types must have <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.UnmanagedCode" /> to set the property value.
trans-unit.target: Los tipos derivados deben tener <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.UnmanagedCode" /> para establecer el valor de propiedad.

trans-unit.source: Represents an invalid native operating system handle.
This field is read-only.
Used internally to initialize the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: Se usa internamente para inicializar el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle%2A> propiedad.

trans-unit.source: You can use this value to determine whether the <see cref="P:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle" /> property contains a valid native operating system handle.
trans-unit.target: Puede utilizar este valor para determinar si el <see cref="P:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Handle" /> propiedad contiene un identificador de sistema operativo nativo válido.

trans-unit.source: Gets or sets the native operating system handle.
A <see cref="T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle" /> representing the native operating system handle.
trans-unit.target: <see cref="T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle" /> que representa el identificador del sistema operativo nativo.

trans-unit.source: When you assign a new value to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> property, the previous handle will be closed when the previous <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle> object is collected.
trans-unit.target: Cuando asigna un nuevo valor para el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> propiedad, se cerrará el identificador anterior al anterior <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle> los objetos se recogen.

trans-unit.source: Do not manually close the handle, because this results in an <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException> when the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle> attempts to close the handle.
trans-unit.target: No cierre el identificador manualmente, ya que esto da como resultado un <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException> cuando el <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle> intenta cerrar el identificador.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> implements the <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> pattern.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle> implementa el <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> patrón.

trans-unit.source: See [Dispose Pattern](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md).
trans-unit.target: Vea [patrón de Dispose](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md).

trans-unit.source: When you derive from <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>, use the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> property to store your native handle operating system handle.
trans-unit.target: Al derivar de <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle>, use el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SafeWaitHandle%2A> propiedad para almacenar el identificador del sistema operativo de identificador nativo.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to override the protected <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose%2A> method unless you use additional unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: No es necesario reemplazar el protegido <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.Dispose%2A> método a menos que utilice recursos no administrados adicionales.

trans-unit.source: Requires full trust for the immediate caller.
trans-unit.target: requiere plena confianza para el llamador inmediato.

trans-unit.source: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
trans-unit.target: Este miembro no puede usarse por código de confianza parcial o transparente.

trans-unit.source: Derived types must have <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.UnmanagedCode" /> to call this member.
trans-unit.target: Los tipos derivados deben tener <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.UnmanagedCode" /> para llamar a este miembro.

trans-unit.source: Signals one <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> and waits on another.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to signal.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to wait on.
Signals one <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> and waits on another.
<see langword="true" /> if both the signal and the wait complete successfully; if the wait does not complete, the method does not return.
This operation is not guaranteed to be atomic.
trans-unit.target: Esta operación no se garantiza para ser atómicas.

trans-unit.source: After the current thread signals `toSignal` but before it waits on `toWaitOn`, a thread that is running on another processor might signal `toWaitOn` or wait on it.
trans-unit.target: Después de las señales de subproceso actual `toSignal` pero antes de que espera en `toWaitOn`, podría señalar a un subproceso que se ejecuta en otro procesador `toWaitOn` o esperar en él.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%2CSystem.Threading.WaitHandle%29> method overload to allow the main thread to signal a blocked thread and then wait until the thread finishes a task.
trans-unit.target: El siguiente ejemplo de código utiliza el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%2CSystem.Threading.WaitHandle%29> sobrecarga del método para permitir que el subproceso principal indicar un subproceso bloqueado y, a continuación, espere a que el subproceso finalice una tarea.

trans-unit.source: The example starts five threads, allows them to block on an <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> created with the <xref:System.Threading.EventResetMode.AutoReset?displayProperty=nameWithType> flag, and then releases one thread each time the user presses the ENTER key.
trans-unit.target: El ejemplo inicia cinco subprocesos, se les permite bloquearse en un <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> creado con el <xref:System.Threading.EventResetMode.AutoReset?displayProperty=nameWithType> marca y a continuación versiones un subproceso cada vez el usuario presiona la tecla ENTRAR.

trans-unit.source: The example then queues another five threads and releases them all using an <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> created with the <xref:System.Threading.EventResetMode.ManualReset?displayProperty=nameWithType> flag.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo, a continuación, pone en cola otros cinco subprocesos y se liberan todos ellos utilizando una <xref:System.Threading.EventWaitHandle> creado con el <xref:System.Threading.EventResetMode.ManualReset?displayProperty=nameWithType> marca.

trans-unit.source: <paramref name="toSignal" /> is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="toWaitOn" /> is <see langword="null" />.
The method was called on a thread that has <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" />.
This method is not supported on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
<paramref name="toSignal" /> is a semaphore, and it already has a full count.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to signal.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to wait on.
An integer that represents the interval to wait.
If the value is <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" />, that is, -1, the wait is infinite.
<see langword="true" /> to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it afterward; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Signals one <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> and waits on another, specifying a time-out interval as a 32-bit signed integer and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain for the context before entering the wait.
<see langword="true" /> if both the signal and the wait completed successfully, or <see langword="false" /> if the signal completed but the wait timed out.
This operation is not guaranteed to be atomic.
trans-unit.target: Esta operación no se garantiza para ser atómicas.

trans-unit.source: After the current thread signals `toSignal` but before it waits on `toWaitOn`, a thread that is running on another processor might signal `toWaitOn` or wait on it.
trans-unit.target: Después de las señales de subproceso actual `toSignal` pero antes de que espera en `toWaitOn`, podría señalar a un subproceso que se ejecuta en otro procesador `toWaitOn` o esperar en él.

trans-unit.source: If `millisecondsTimeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `millisecondsTimeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the `toWaitOn` and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba que el estado de la `toWaitOn` y se devuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: Notes on Exiting the Context
trans-unit.target: Notas sobre la salida del contexto

trans-unit.source: The `exitContext` parameter has no effect unless the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> method is called from inside a nondefault managed context.
trans-unit.target: El `exitContext` parámetro no tiene ningún efecto a menos que el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> método se llama desde dentro de un contexto administrado no predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if your thread is inside a call to an instance of a class derived from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ocurrir si el subproceso está dentro de una llamada a una instancia de una clase derivada de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.

trans-unit.source: Even if you are currently executing a method on a class that does not derive from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, like <xref:System.String>, you can be in a nondefault context if a <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> is on your stack in the current application domain.
trans-unit.target: Incluso si está ejecutando actualmente un método en una clase que no se deriva de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, como <xref:System.String>, puede estar en un contexto no predeterminado si un <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> en la pila en el dominio de aplicación actual.

trans-unit.source: When your code is executing in a nondefault context, specifying `true` for `exitContext` causes the thread to exit the nondefault managed context (that is, to transition to the default context) before executing the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el código se ejecuta en un contexto no predeterminado, especificar `true` para `exitContext` hace que el subproceso salga del contexto administrado no predeterminado (es decir, pase al contexto predeterminado) antes de ejecutar el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: The thread returns to the original nondefault context after the call to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> method completes.
trans-unit.target: El subproceso vuelve al contexto no predeterminado original después de llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> método se completa.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful when the context-bound class has <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ser útil cuando la clase enlazadas a un contexto tiene <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: In that case, all calls to members of the class are automatically synchronized, and the synchronization domain is the entire body of code for the class.
trans-unit.target: En ese caso, todas las llamadas a miembros de la clase se sincronizan automáticamente y el dominio de sincronización es el cuerpo completo del código de la clase.

trans-unit.source: If code in the call stack of a member calls the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> method and specifies `true` for `exitContext`, the thread exits the synchronization domain, allowing a thread that is blocked on a call to any member of the object to proceed.
trans-unit.target: Si el código de la pila de llamadas de un miembro llama el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> método y especifica `true` para `exitContext`, el subproceso sale del dominio de sincronización, permitiendo la continuación un subproceso que esté bloqueado en una llamada a cualquier miembro del objeto para continuar.

trans-unit.source: When the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> method returns, the thread that made the call must wait to reenter the synchronization domain.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.SignalAndWait%2A> método vuelve, el subproceso que realiza la llamada debe esperar para volver a escribir el dominio de sincronización.

trans-unit.source: <paramref name="toSignal" /> is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="toWaitOn" /> is <see langword="null" />.
The method is called on a thread that has <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" />.
This method is not supported on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> cannot be signaled because it would exceed its maximum count.
<paramref name="millisecondsTimeout" /> is a negative number other than -1, which represents an infinite time-out.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to signal.
The <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> to wait on.
A <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents the interval to wait.
If the value is -1, the wait is infinite.
<see langword="true" /> to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it afterward; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Signals one <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> and waits on another, specifying the time-out interval as a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain for the context before entering the wait.
<see langword="true" /> if both the signal and the wait completed successfully, or <see langword="false" /> if the signal completed but the wait timed out.
This operation is not guaranteed to be atomic.
trans-unit.target: Esta operación no se garantiza para ser atómicas.

trans-unit.source: After the current thread signals `toSignal` but before it waits on `toWaitOn`, a thread that is running on another processor might signal `toWaitOn` or wait on it.
trans-unit.target: Después de las señales de subproceso actual `toSignal` pero antes de que espera en `toWaitOn`, podría señalar a un subproceso que se ejecuta en otro procesador `toWaitOn` o esperar en él.

trans-unit.source: The maximum value for `timeout` is <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
trans-unit.target: El valor máximo de `timeout` es <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

trans-unit.source: If `timeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `timeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the `toWaitOn` and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba que el estado de la `toWaitOn` y se devuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: Notes on Exiting the Context
trans-unit.target: Notas sobre la salida del contexto

trans-unit.source: <paramref name="toSignal" /> is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="toWaitOn" /> is <see langword="null" />.
The method was called on a thread that has <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" />.
This method is not supported on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
<paramref name="toSignal" /> is a semaphore, and it already has a full count.
<paramref name="timeout" /> evaluates to a negative number of milliseconds other than -1.
-or-
<paramref name="timeout" /> is greater than <see cref="F:System.Int32.MaxValue" />.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
Waits for all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
This array cannot contain multiple references to the same object.
Waits for all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal.
<see langword="true" /> when every element in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> has received a signal; otherwise the method never returns.
<xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> Novedades en la versión 2.0 de .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns `true` when a mutex is abandoned.
trans-unit.target: En versiones anteriores, el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método `true` cuando se abandona una exclusión mutua.

trans-unit.source: An abandoned mutex often indicates a serious coding error.
trans-unit.target: A menudo, un mutex abandonado indica un error de codificación grave.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a system-wide mutex, it might indicate that an application has been terminated abruptly (for example, by using Windows Task Manager).
trans-unit.target: En el caso de una exclusión mutua todo el sistema, podría indicar que una aplicación ha finalizado inesperadamente (por ejemplo, mediante el Administrador de tareas de Windows).

trans-unit.source: The exception contains information useful for debugging.
trans-unit.target: La excepción contiene información útil para la depuración.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns when all the handles are signaled.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método devuelve cuando se señalan todos los identificadores.

trans-unit.source: On some implementations, if more than 64 handles are passed, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan más de 64 identificadores, un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: If the array contains duplicates, the call fails with a <xref:System.DuplicateWaitObjectException>.
trans-unit.target: Si la matriz contiene duplicados, se produce un error en la llamada con un <xref:System.DuplicateWaitObjectException>.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method is not supported on threads that have <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método no se admite en subprocesos que tienen <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: Calling this method overload is equivalent to calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method overload and specifying -1 (or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>) for `millisecondsTimeout` and `true` for `exitContext`.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a esta sobrecarga del método es equivalente a llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> sobrecarga del método y especificar -1 (o <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>) para `millisecondsTimeout` y `true` para `exitContext`.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to use the thread pool to asynchronously create and write to a group of files.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo utilizar el grupo de subprocesos para crear y escribir en un grupo de archivos de forma asincrónica.

trans-unit.source: Each write operation is queued as a work item and signals when it is finished.
trans-unit.target: Cada operación de escritura se pone en cola como un elemento de trabajo y las señales cuando haya finalizado.

trans-unit.source: The main thread waits for all the items to signal and then exits.
trans-unit.target: El subproceso principal espera a que todos los elementos señalar y, a continuación, se cierra.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array are <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 2.0 or later.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <see cref="T:System.ArgumentException" />, instead.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains elements that are duplicates.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
-or-
The <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" /> attribute is applied to the thread procedure for the current thread, and <paramref name="waitHandles" /> contains more than one element.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.
The wait terminated because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
This array cannot contain multiple references to the same object (duplicates).
The number of milliseconds to wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> (-1) to wait indefinitely.
Waits for all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using an <see cref="T:System.Int32" /> value to specify the time interval.
<see langword="true" /> when every element in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> has received a signal; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
If `millisecondsTimeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `millisecondsTimeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba el estado de los identificadores de espera y vuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns when the wait terminates, which means either when all the handles are signaled or when time-out occurs.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método devuelve cuando finaliza la espera, lo que significa que cuando se señalan todos los identificadores o cuando se produce el tiempo de espera.

trans-unit.source: On some implementations, if more than 64 handles are passed, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan más de 64 identificadores, un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: If there are duplicates in the array, the call fails with a <xref:System.DuplicateWaitObjectException>.
trans-unit.target: Si hay duplicados en la matriz, se produce un error en la llamada con un <xref:System.DuplicateWaitObjectException>.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method is not supported on threads that have <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método no se admite en subprocesos que tienen <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: Calling this method overload is the same as calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> overload and specifying `false` for `exitContext`.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a esta sobrecarga del método es igual que llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> sobrecarga y la especificación `false` para `exitContext`.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <see cref="T:System.ArgumentException" />, instead.

This array cannot contain multiple references to the same object.
A <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents -1 milliseconds, to wait indefinitely.
Waits for all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> value to specify the time interval.
<see langword="true" /> when every element in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> has received a signal; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
If `timeout` is zero, the method does not block.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns when the wait terminates, which means either all the handles are signaled or a time-out occurs.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método devuelve cuando finaliza la espera, lo que significa que todos los identificadores están señalados o se produce un tiempo de espera.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method is not supported on threads that have <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método no se admite en subprocesos que tienen <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: Notes on Exiting the Context
trans-unit.target: Notas sobre la salida del contexto

trans-unit.source: The `exitContext` parameter has no effect unless the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method is called from inside a nondefault managed context.
trans-unit.target: El `exitContext` parámetro no tiene ningún efecto a menos que el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método se llama desde dentro de un contexto administrado no predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if your thread is inside a call to an instance of a class derived from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ocurrir si el subproceso está dentro de una llamada a una instancia de una clase derivada de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.

trans-unit.source: Even if you are currently executing a method on a class that is not derived from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, like <xref:System.String>, you can be in a nondefault context if a <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> is on your stack in the current application domain.
trans-unit.target: Incluso si está ejecutando actualmente un método en una clase que no se deriva de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, como <xref:System.String>, puede estar en un contexto no predeterminado si un <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> en la pila en el dominio de aplicación actual.

trans-unit.source: When your code is executing in a nondefault context, specifying `true` for `exitContext` causes the thread to exit the nondefault managed context (that is, to transition to the default context) before executing the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el código se ejecuta en un contexto no predeterminado, especificar `true` para `exitContext` hace que el subproceso salga del contexto administrado no predeterminado (es decir, pase al contexto predeterminado) antes de ejecutar el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: The thread returns to the original nondefault context after the call to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method completes.
trans-unit.target: El subproceso vuelve al contexto no predeterminado original después de llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método se completa.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful when the context-bound class has the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute> attribute.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ser útil cuando la clase enlazadas a un contexto tiene la <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute> atributo.

trans-unit.source: In that case, all calls to members of the class are automatically synchronized, and the synchronization domain is the entire body of code for the class.
trans-unit.target: En ese caso, todas las llamadas a miembros de la clase se sincronizan automáticamente y el dominio de sincronización es el cuerpo completo del código de la clase.

trans-unit.source: If code in the call stack of a member calls the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method and specifies `true` for `exitContext`, the thread exits the synchronization domain, allowing a thread that is blocked on a call to any member of the object to proceed.
trans-unit.target: Si el código de la pila de llamadas de un miembro llama el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método y especifica `true` para `exitContext`, el subproceso sale del dominio de sincronización, permitiendo la continuación un subproceso que esté bloqueado en una llamada a cualquier miembro del objeto para continuar.

trans-unit.source: When the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns, the thread that made the call must wait to reenter the synchronization domain.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método vuelve, el subproceso que realiza la llamada debe esperar para volver a escribir el dominio de sincronización.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to use the thread pool to asynchronously create and write to a group of files.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo utilizar el grupo de subprocesos para crear y escribir en un grupo de archivos de forma asincrónica.

trans-unit.source: Each write operation is queued as a work item and signals when it is finished.
trans-unit.target: Cada operación de escritura se pone en cola como un elemento de trabajo y las señales cuando haya finalizado.

trans-unit.source: The main thread waits for all the items to signal and then exits.
trans-unit.target: El subproceso principal espera a que todos los elementos señalar y, a continuación, se cierra.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 2.0 or later.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains elements that are duplicates.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
-or-
The <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" /> attribute is applied to the thread procedure for the current thread, and <paramref name="waitHandles" /> contains more than one element.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.
<paramref name="millisecondsTimeout" /> is a negative number other than -1, which represents an infinite time-out.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
This array cannot contain multiple references to the same object.
A <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents -1 milliseconds, to wait indefinitely.
<see langword="true" /> to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it afterward; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Waits for all the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> value to specify the time interval, and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain before the wait.
<see langword="true" /> when every element in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> has received a signal; otherwise <see langword="false" />.
If `timeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `timeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba el estado de los identificadores de espera y vuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> Novedades en la versión 2.0 de .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns `true` when a mutex is abandoned.
trans-unit.target: En versiones anteriores, el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método `true` cuando se abandona una exclusión mutua.

trans-unit.source: An abandoned mutex often indicates a serious coding error.
trans-unit.target: A menudo, un mutex abandonado indica un error de codificación grave.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a system-wide mutex, it might indicate that an application has been terminated abruptly (for example, by using Windows Task Manager).
trans-unit.target: En el caso de una exclusión mutua todo el sistema, podría indicar que una aplicación ha finalizado inesperadamente (por ejemplo, mediante el Administrador de tareas de Windows).

trans-unit.source: The exception contains information useful for debugging.
trans-unit.target: La excepción contiene información útil para la depuración.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method returns when the wait terminates, which means either all the handles are signaled or a time-out occurs.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método devuelve cuando finaliza la espera, lo que significa que todos los identificadores están señalados o se produce un tiempo de espera.

trans-unit.source: On some implementations, if more than 64 handles are passed, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan más de 64 identificadores, un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: If the array contains duplicates, the call will fail.
trans-unit.target: Si la matriz contiene duplicados, se producirá un error en la llamada.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> method is not supported on threads that have <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAll%2A> método no se admite en subprocesos que tienen <xref:System.STAThreadAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: The maximum value for `timeout` is <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
trans-unit.target: El valor máximo de `timeout` es <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

trans-unit.source: Notes on Exiting the Context
trans-unit.target: Notas sobre la salida del contexto

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to use the thread pool to asynchronously create and write to a group of files.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo utilizar el grupo de subprocesos para crear y escribir en un grupo de archivos de forma asincrónica.

-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 2.0 or later.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains elements that are duplicates.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
-or-
The <see cref="T:System.STAThreadAttribute" /> attribute is applied to the thread procedure for the current thread, and <paramref name="waitHandles" /> contains more than one element.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.
<paramref name="timeout" /> is a negative number other than -1 milliseconds, which represents an infinite time-out.
-or-
<paramref name="timeout" /> is greater than <see cref="F:System.Int32.MaxValue" />.
The wait terminated because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
Waits for any of the elements in the specified array to receive a signal.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
Waits for any of the elements in the specified array to receive a signal.
The array index of the object that satisfied the wait.
<xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> Novedades en la versión 2.0 de .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method returns `true` if the wait completes because a mutex is abandoned.
trans-unit.target: En versiones anteriores, el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método `true` si la espera finaliza porque se abandona una exclusión mutua.

trans-unit.source: An abandoned mutex often indicates a serious coding error.
trans-unit.target: A menudo, un mutex abandonado indica un error de codificación grave.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a system-wide mutex, it might indicate that an application has been terminated abruptly (for example, by using Windows Task Manager).
trans-unit.target: En el caso de una exclusión mutua todo el sistema, podría indicar que una aplicación ha finalizado inesperadamente (por ejemplo, mediante el Administrador de tareas de Windows).

trans-unit.source: The exception contains information useful for debugging.
trans-unit.target: La excepción contiene información útil para la depuración.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> only when the wait completes because of an abandoned mutex.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método produce un <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> sólo cuando finaliza la espera debido a un mutex abandonado.

trans-unit.source: If `waitHandles` contains a released mutex with a lower index number than the abandoned mutex, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method completes normally and the exception is not thrown.
trans-unit.target: Si `waitHandles` contiene una exclusión mutua liberada con un número de índice menor que el mutex abandonado la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método se completa con normalidad y no se produce la excepción.

trans-unit.source: In versions of the .NET Framework earlier than version 2.0, if a thread exits or aborts without explicitly releasing a <xref:System.Threading.Mutex>, and that `Mutex` is at index 0 (zero) in a `WaitAny` array on another thread, the index returned by `WaitAny` is 128 instead of 0.
trans-unit.target: En las versiones de .NET Framework anterior a la versión 2.0, si un subproceso termina o se interrumpe sin liberar explícitamente un <xref:System.Threading.Mutex>y que `Mutex` está en el índice 0 (cero) en un `WaitAny` matriz en otro subproceso, el índice devuelto por `WaitAny` es 128 en lugar de 0.

trans-unit.source: This method returns when any handle is signaled.
trans-unit.target: Este método devuelve cuando se señala a cualquiera de ellos.

trans-unit.source: If more than one object becomes signaled during the call, the return value is the array index of the signaled object with the smallest index value of all the signaled objects.
trans-unit.target: Si más de un objeto se señaliza durante la llamada, el valor devuelto es el índice de matriz del objeto señalado con el menor valor de índice de todos los objetos señalados.

trans-unit.source: On some implementations, if more that 64 handles are passed, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan 64 identificadores, más de un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: Calling this method overload is equivalent to calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method overload and specifying -1 (or <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>) for `millisecondsTimeout` and `true` for `exitContext`.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a esta sobrecarga del método es equivalente a llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> sobrecarga del método y especificar -1 (o <xref:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite?displayProperty=nameWithType>) para `millisecondsTimeout` y `true` para `exitContext`.

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements, and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements, and the .NET Framework version is 2.0 or later.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> (-1) to wait indefinitely.
Waits for any of the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using a 32-bit signed integer to specify the time interval.

The array index of the object that satisfied the wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitTimeout" /> if no object satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to <paramref name="millisecondsTimeout" /> has passed.
If `millisecondsTimeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `millisecondsTimeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba el estado de los identificadores de espera y vuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> only when the wait completes because of an abandoned mutex.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método produce un <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> sólo cuando finaliza la espera debido a un mutex abandonado.

trans-unit.source: If `waitHandles` contains a released mutex with a lower index number than the abandoned mutex, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method completes normally and the exception is not thrown.
trans-unit.target: Si `waitHandles` contiene una exclusión mutua liberada con un número de índice menor que el mutex abandonado la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método se completa con normalidad y no se produce la excepción.

trans-unit.source: This method returns when the wait terminates, either when any of the handles are signaled or when a timeout occurs.
trans-unit.target: Este método devuelve cuando finaliza la espera, cuando cualquiera de los identificadores está señalado o cuando se produce un tiempo de espera.

trans-unit.source: If more than one object becomes signaled during the call, the return value is the array index of the signaled object with the smallest index value of all the signaled objects.
trans-unit.target: Si más de un objeto se señaliza durante la llamada, el valor devuelto es el índice de matriz del objeto señalado con el menor valor de índice de todos los objetos señalados.

trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan 64 identificadores, más de un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: Calling this method overload is the same as calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> overload and specifying `false` for `exitContext`.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a esta sobrecarga del método es igual que llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> sobrecarga y la especificación `false` para `exitContext`.

trans-unit.source: The maximum value for `timeout` is <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
trans-unit.target: El valor máximo de `timeout` es <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

trans-unit.source: Calling this method overload is the same as calling the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.TimeSpan%2CSystem.Boolean%29> overload and specifying `false` for `exitContext`.
trans-unit.target: Llamar a esta sobrecarga del método es igual que llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%28System.Threading.WaitHandle%5B%5D%2CSystem.TimeSpan%2CSystem.Boolean%29> sobrecarga y la especificación `false` para `exitContext`.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
<paramref name="timeout" /> is a negative number other than -1 milliseconds, which represents an infinite time-out.
-or-
<paramref name="timeout" /> is greater than <see cref="F:System.Int32.MaxValue" />.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite" /> (-1) to wait indefinitely.
<see langword="true" /> to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it afterward; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Waits for any of the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using a 32-bit signed integer to specify the time interval, and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain before the wait.

The array index of the object that satisfied the wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitTimeout" /> if no object satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to <paramref name="millisecondsTimeout" /> has passed.
If `millisecondsTimeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `millisecondsTimeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba el estado de los identificadores de espera y vuelve inmediatamente.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> Novedades en la versión 2.0 de .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method returns `true` if the wait completes because a mutex is abandoned.
trans-unit.target: En versiones anteriores, el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método `true` si la espera finaliza porque se abandona una exclusión mutua.

trans-unit.source: An abandoned mutex often indicates a serious coding error.
trans-unit.target: A menudo, un mutex abandonado indica un error de codificación grave.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a system-wide mutex, it might indicate that an application has been terminated abruptly (for example, by using Windows Task Manager).
trans-unit.target: En el caso de una exclusión mutua todo el sistema, podría indicar que una aplicación ha finalizado inesperadamente (por ejemplo, mediante el Administrador de tareas de Windows).

trans-unit.source: The exception contains information useful for debugging.
trans-unit.target: La excepción contiene información útil para la depuración.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> only when the wait completes because of an abandoned mutex.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método produce un <xref:System.Threading.AbandonedMutexException> sólo cuando finaliza la espera debido a un mutex abandonado.

trans-unit.source: If `waitHandles` contains a released mutex with a lower index number than the abandoned mutex, the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method completes normally and the exception is not thrown.
trans-unit.target: Si `waitHandles` contiene una exclusión mutua liberada con un número de índice menor que el mutex abandonado la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método se completa con normalidad y no se produce la excepción.

trans-unit.source: In versions of the .NET Framework earlier than version 2.0, if a thread exits or aborts without explicitly releasing a <xref:System.Threading.Mutex>, and that `Mutex` is at index 0 (zero) in a `WaitAny` array on another thread, the index returned by `WaitAny` is 128 instead of 0.
trans-unit.target: En las versiones de .NET Framework anterior a la versión 2.0, si un subproceso termina o se interrumpe sin liberar explícitamente un <xref:System.Threading.Mutex>y que `Mutex` está en el índice 0 (cero) en un `WaitAny` matriz en otro subproceso, el índice devuelto por `WaitAny` es 128 en lugar de 0.

trans-unit.source: This method returns when the wait terminates, either when any of the handles are signaled or when a timeout occurs.
trans-unit.target: Este método devuelve cuando finaliza la espera, cuando cualquiera de los identificadores está señalado o cuando se produce un tiempo de espera.

trans-unit.source: If more than one object becomes signaled during the call, the return value is the array index of the signaled object with the smallest index value of all the signaled objects.
trans-unit.target: Si más de un objeto se señaliza durante la llamada, el valor devuelto es el índice de matriz del objeto señalado con el menor valor de índice de todos los objetos señalados.

trans-unit.source: On some implementations, if more that 64 handles are passed, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
trans-unit.target: En algunas implementaciones, si se pasan 64 identificadores, más de un <xref:System.NotSupportedException> se produce.

trans-unit.source: Notes on Exiting the Context
trans-unit.target: Notas sobre la salida del contexto

trans-unit.source: The `exitContext` parameter has no effect unless the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method is called from inside a nondefault managed context.
trans-unit.target: El `exitContext` parámetro no tiene ningún efecto a menos que el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método se llama desde dentro de un contexto administrado no predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if your thread is inside a call to an instance of a class derived from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ocurrir si el subproceso está dentro de una llamada a una instancia de una clase derivada de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>.

trans-unit.source: Even if you are currently executing a method on a class that does not derive from <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, like <xref:System.String>, you can be in a nondefault context if a <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> is on your stack in the current application domain.
trans-unit.target: Incluso si está ejecutando actualmente un método en una clase que no se deriva de <xref:System.ContextBoundObject>, como <xref:System.String>, puede estar en un contexto no predeterminado si un <xref:System.ContextBoundObject> en la pila en el dominio de aplicación actual.

trans-unit.source: When your code is executing in a nondefault context, specifying `true` for `exitContext` causes the thread to exit the nondefault managed context (that is, to transition to the default context) before executing the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el código se ejecuta en un contexto no predeterminado, especificar `true` para `exitContext` hace que el subproceso salga del contexto administrado no predeterminado (es decir, pase al contexto predeterminado) antes de ejecutar el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: The thread returns to the original nondefault context after the call to the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method completes.
trans-unit.target: El subproceso vuelve al contexto no predeterminado original después de llamar a la <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método se completa.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful when the context-bound class has <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute>.
trans-unit.target: Esto puede ser útil cuando la clase enlazadas a un contexto tiene <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.SynchronizationAttribute>.

trans-unit.source: In that case, all calls to members of the class are automatically synchronized, and the synchronization domain is the entire body of code for the class.
trans-unit.target: En ese caso, todas las llamadas a miembros de la clase se sincronizan automáticamente y el dominio de sincronización es el cuerpo completo del código de la clase.

trans-unit.source: If code in the call stack of a member calls the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method and specifies `true` for `exitContext`, the thread exits the synchronization domain, allowing a thread that is blocked on a call to any member of the object to proceed.
trans-unit.target: Si el código de la pila de llamadas de un miembro llama el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método y especifica `true` para `exitContext`, el subproceso sale del dominio de sincronización, permitiendo la continuación un subproceso que esté bloqueado en una llamada a cualquier miembro del objeto para continuar.

trans-unit.source: When the <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> method returns, the thread that made the call must wait to reenter the synchronization domain.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el <xref:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitAny%2A> método vuelve, el subproceso que realiza la llamada debe esperar para volver a escribir el dominio de sincronización.

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates how to use the thread pool to simultaneously search for a file on multiple disks.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo utilizar el grupo de subprocesos para buscar un archivo en varios discos al mismo tiempo.

trans-unit.source: For space considerations, only the root directory of each disk is searched.
trans-unit.target: Por motivos de espacio, se busca únicamente el directorio raíz de cada disco.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
-or-
One or more of the objects in the <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array is <see langword="null" />.
The number of objects in <paramref name="waitHandles" /> is greater than the system permits.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements, and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.
<paramref name="millisecondsTimeout" /> is a negative number other than -1, which represents an infinite time-out.
The wait completed because a thread exited without releasing a mutex.
This exception is not thrown on Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
<paramref name="waitHandles" /> is an array with no elements, and the .NET Framework version is 2.0 or later.
The <paramref name="waitHandles" /> array contains a transparent proxy for a <see cref="T:System.Threading.WaitHandle" /> in another application domain.
A <see langword="WaitHandle" /> array containing the objects for which the current instance will wait.
A <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
<see langword="true" /> to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it afterward; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

Waits for any of the elements in the specified array to receive a signal, using a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan" /> to specify the time interval and specifying whether to exit the synchronization domain before the wait.

The array index of the object that satisfied the wait, or <see cref="F:System.Threading.WaitHandle.WaitTimeout" /> if no object satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to <paramref name="timeout" /> has passed.
If `timeout` is zero, the method does not block.
trans-unit.target: Si `timeout` es cero, el método no se bloquea.

trans-unit.source: It tests the state of the wait handles and returns immediately.
trans-unit.target: Comprueba el estado de los identificadores de espera y vuelve inmediatamente.
